{"step_by_step_thinking": "Extension of odontoblast processes into enamel is a characteristic feature of enamel formation. Odontoblasts are cells that produce dentin, not enamel. Enamel spindles are defects in enamel formation and are not related to odontoblast processes. Cracks are also not related to odontoblast processes. Primary dentin is the dentin formed during tooth development, and odontoblast processes do not extend into enamel. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Secondary Dentine.", "answer_choice": "D"}
